intro: Collomia debilis subsp. typica, commonly known as the slender collomia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, often in areas with well-drained soil. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. This subspecies is relatively small, with height varying from 10 to 30 centimeters.
